''Māchananaškad'' ([[Valarin|V]]) | location=Near [[Valimar]] at the heart of [[Valinor]] | type=Court/hall | description=A circle filled with the thrones of the Valar | regions= | towns= | inhabitants=[[Valar]] | created={{VY|3500}} | destroyed= | rebuilt= | events=[[Darkening of Valinor]] }} '''Máhanaxar''', also called '''Rithil-Anamo''',{{WJ|Quendi}}{{rp|401}} was the '''Ring of Doom''', probably a hall or court where the [[Valar]] held their councils. ==History== The Ring of Doom was located outside the golden western gates of the city of [[Valimar]] with the thrones of the Valar that were arranged in circle.{{S|1}} The evergreen hill of [[Ezellohar]], upon which [[Two Trees of Valinor|Two Trees]] of [[Valinor]] grew until its [[Darkening of Valinor|Darkening]], laid within the Ring.{{MR|P2a}}, entry 3500, §§ 25-6, p. 55 The Valar were sitting on their thrones while watching [[Yavanna]] chanting, bringing the Two Trees to life upon Ezellohar. Ever after, the Powers sat bathed in the light of the Trees to hold their great councils, and here some of the most momentous decisions of [[Eä]]'s history were made. ==Etymology== The name ''Máhanaxar'' is how the [[Amanyar]] called the Ring of Doom in [[Quenya]]. It contains the word ''Máhan'' "[[Aratar|chief Vala]]", itself a loan from [[Valarin]] ''māchanāz''{{rp|402}} "[[Authorities|Authority]]".{{rp|399}} All in all, ''Máhanaxar'' is said to be derived from [[Valarin]] '''''Māchananaškad''''', a compound that includes the aforementioned ''māchanāz''. It has been suggested that the second element might mean "ring" and is related to [[Black Speech]] ''[[nazg]]''.{{webcite|articleurl=https://folk.uib.no/hnohf/valarin.htm|articlename=Valarin|website=Arda|accessed=10 March 2020}} Cf. also [[NASAG]]. The word was translated as ''Rithil-Anamo'' in the Quenya of Aman. The word ''rithil'', that probably means "ring", is otherwise unattested. The second word might be the genitive form of an otherwise unattested noun *''anan'' (or less probably *''anama''), itself probably derived from [[root]] NAM (cf. [[Námo]], the name of Mandos).{{webcite|author=[[Helge Fauskanger]]|articleurl=http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/quen-eng.htm|articlename=Quettaparma Quenyallo|website=Arda}} ==Other version of the legendarium== In the [[Later Quenta Silmarillion|Later ''Quenta Silmarillion'']], as Melkor came through [[Aman]] and filled it with darkness and dread, he entered the Ring of Doom and cursed it, defiling Manwë's seat of judgement and casting down the thrones of the other Valar.{{MR|P3II7}} {{references}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mahanaxar}} [[Category:Valinor]] [[Category:Quenya locations]] [[de:Máhanaxar]] [[fr:encyclo/geographie/regions/aman/mahanaxar]] [[fi:Máhanaxar]] [[fi:Rithil-Anamo]]
